headline.seo: In Energy Conservation, a Focus on Bragging Rights

docs.snippet: Utility companies are trying to use social media, competitive games and Big Brother-style data analysis to persuade customers to use less electricity....
docs.abstract: Utility companies are using a number of tactics, including social media, games and data analysis of energy use, to persuade customers to use less electricity; utilities face government mandates to encourage conservation and to deal with the rising cost and difficulties involved in building power plants and distribution systems.
docs.lead_paragraph: Utility companies are trying to use social media, competitive games and Big Brother-style data analysis to persuade customers to use less electricity.

headline.print_headline: Hints of the Past In a Garden Of New Quartets
headline.seo: Summergarden Features Juilliard Musicians at MoMA
headline.main: Hints of the Past in a Garden of New Quartets

docs.snippet: A second Juilliard concert at the Museum of Modern Art, on Sunday evening in the Abby Aldrich Rockefeller Sculpture Garden, was devoted to string quartets, chosen by Joel Sachs....
docs.abstract: Allan Kozinn reviews performance by the New Juilliard Ensemble at the Abby Aldrich Rockefeller Sculpture Garden at the Museum of Modern Art, as part of the Summergarden concert series.
docs.lead_paragraph: A second Juilliard concert at the Museum of Modern Art, on Sunday evening in the Abby Aldrich Rockefeller Sculpture Garden, was devoted to string quartets, chosen by Joel Sachs.

headline.seo: Sally Ride, Trailblazing Astronaut, Dies at 61
headline.main: American Woman Who Shattered Space Ceiling

docs.snippet: Dr. Ride was the first American woman in space, flying on two missions on the shuttle Challenger....
docs.abstract: Sally Ride, physicist and former NASA astronaut who in 1983 became the first American woman to fly in space, dies at age 61.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Ride was the first American woman in space, flying on two missions on the shuttle Challenger.

headline.seo: New Music by Passion Pit and Micachu & the Shapes
headline.main: Releases by Passion Pit, Micachu & the Shapes and Hafez Modirzadeh

docs.snippet: “Gossamer” by Passion Pit; “Never” by Micachu & the Shapes; and “Post-Chromodal Out!” by Hafez Modirzadeh....
docs.abstract: Jon Pareles reviews Gossamer, latest CD from electropop band Passion Pit; Ben Ratliff reviews Never, most recent album from experimental pop group Micachu & the Shapes; Nate Chinen reviews Post-Chromodal Out!, newest release by saxophonist Hafez Modirzadeh.

byline.original: By JON PARELES, BEN RATLIFF and NATE CHINEN

docs.lead_paragraph: “Gossamer” by Passion Pit; “Never” by Micachu & the Shapes; and “Post-Chromodal Out!” by Hafez Modirzadeh.

headline.print_headline: The Masurs, Father and Son, Share the Baton
headline.seo: Kurt Masur and Ken-David Masur at Tanglewood Festival
headline.main: The Masurs, Father and Son, Share the Baton

docs.snippet: At Tanglewood on Sunday, Kurt Masur conducted Mozart’s “Linz” Symphony after intermission after turning over the first half of the program to his son, Ken-David Masur....
docs.abstract: James R Oestreich reviews a program of all-Mozart works performed by the Boston Symphony Orchestra, conducted by Kurt Masur and his son Ken-David Masur, at the Tanglewood Festival in Lenox, Mass.
docs.lead_paragraph: At Tanglewood on Sunday, Kurt Masur conducted Mozart’s “Linz” Symphony after intermission after turning over the first half of the program to his son, Ken-David Masur.

headline.print_headline: More Than An Escape For the Elite
headline.seo: Very Old and Brand-New Operas at French Festival
headline.main: More Than an Escape for the Elite

docs.snippet: The reputation of the Festival International d’Art Lyrique d’Aix-en-Provence, in France, has been growing, thanks to productions like those at this year’s edition....
docs.abstract: Zachary Woolfe says that the summer opera event Festival International d’Art Lyrique d’Aix-en-Provence, in France, has a growing reputation, thanks to its presentation of well-crafted productions.
docs.lead_paragraph: The reputation of the Festival International d’Art Lyrique d’Aix-en-Provence, in France, has been growing, thanks to productions like those at this year’s edition.

headline.print_headline: Peering Into the Exquisite Life of Rare Books
headline.seo: Rare Book School at the University of Virginia
headline.main: Peering Into the Exquisite Life of Rare Books

docs.snippet: At Rare Book School, librarians, scholars, collectors and random book-mad civilians get a chance to see jaw-dropping masterpieces of printing....
docs.abstract: Rare Book School at the University of Virginia brings some 300 librarians, conservators, scholars, dealers, collectors and book lovers together for week-long intensive courses; summer program fills an important intellectual niche, teaching skills and knowledge that is threatened in the age of increasingly technology-minded library schools and theory-oriented literature departments.
docs.lead_paragraph: At Rare Book School, librarians, scholars, collectors and random book-mad civilians get a chance to see jaw-dropping masterpieces of printing.

headline.print_headline: A Singer With Many Musical Identities
headline.seo: Alice Ripley at the Metropolitan Room
headline.main: A Singer With Many Musical Identities

docs.snippet: For Alice Ripley, who is performing at the Metropolitan Room, tricky questions of musical identity arise....
docs.abstract: Stephen Holden reviews performance by singer-songwriter Alice Ripley at the Metropolitan Room.
docs.lead_paragraph: For Alice Ripley, who is performing at the Metropolitan Room, tricky questions of musical identity arise.

headline.print_headline: To Hotel Guests, Sleep Is a Start
headline.seo: Consumer Reports Finds Sleep Still No. 1 for Hotel Guests
headline.main: To Hotel Guests, Sleep Is a Start

docs.snippet: In evaluations of hotel chains, consistency across the brand appears to be the key to customer satisfaction....
docs.abstract: Consumer Reports survey of more than 22,000 readers about their stays at 44 hotel chains finds a strong connection between guest satisfaction and brand consistency; other industry surveys, from both traditional researchers and travel Web sites, find similar results.
docs.lead_paragraph: In evaluations of hotel chains, consistency across the brand appears to be the key to customer satisfaction.
